sn35.68:4.1: “Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the world’.
sn35.68:4.2: How do we define the world or what is known as the world?”
sn35.68:4.3: “Samiddhi, where there is the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by eye consciousness, there is the world or what is known as the world.
sn35.68:4.4: Where there is the ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.68:4.5: Where there is the mind, phenomena, mind consciousness, and phenomena cognizable by mind consciousness, there is the world or what is known as the world.
sn35.68:5.1: Where there is no eye, no sights, no eye consciousness, and no phenomena cognizable by eye consciousness, there is no world or what is known as the world.
sn35.68:5.2: Where there is no ear … nose … tongue … body …
sn35.68:5.3: Where there is no mind, no phenomena, no mind consciousness, and no phenomena cognizable by mind consciousness, there is no world or what is known as the world.”
